intro: Aira caryophyllea subsp. plesiantha, commonly known as the Plesiantha grass, is a perennial grass species native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive blue-green hue. It plays an important ecological role in supporting native insect and bird populations.
